entry.title: Spike and nsp6 are key determinants of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron BA.1 attenuation
entry.content:
Spike and nsp6 are key determinants of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron BA.1 attenuation

  • Da-Yuan Chen
  • Chue Vin Chin

Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Financial incentives for vaccination do not have negative unintended consequences
entry.content:
Financial incentives for vaccination do not have negative unintended consequences

Findings from large-scale studies in Sweden and the USA indicate that providing financial incentives for vaccination and informing about state incentive programmes do not have any negative unintended consequences.

  • Florian H. Schneider
  • Pol Campos-Mercade
  • Armando N. Meier
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Grain shape effects in bed load sediment transport
entry.content:
Grain shape effects in bed load sediment transport

Theoretical and experimental analysis of the effect of grain shape in bed load sediment transport is performed and a shape-corrected sediment transport law that provides greater accuracy in predictions is proposed.

  • Eric Deal
  • Jeremy G. Venditti
  • J. Taylor Perron
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: A ligand insertion mechanism for cooperative NH3 capture in metal–organic frameworks
entry.content:
A ligand insertion mechanism for cooperative NH3 capture in metal–organic frameworks

A three-dimensional metal–organic framework reversibly binds ammonia by cooperative insertion into its metal–linker bonds to form a dense, one-dimensional coordination polymer, enabling high-capacity ammonia uptake with intrinsic thermal management.

  • Benjamin E. R. Snyder
  • Ari B. Turkiewicz
  • Jeffrey R. Long
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: γδ T cells are effectors of immunotherapy in cancers with HLA class I defects
entry.content:
γδ T cells are effectors of immunotherapy in cancers with HLA class I defects

γδ T cells contribute to the response to immune checkpoint blockade treatment in patients with HLA-class-I-negative DNA mismatch repair-deficient colon cancers. .

  • Natasja L. de Vries
  • Joris van de Haar
  • Emile E. Voest
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Seasonal temperatures in West Antarctica during the Holocene
entry.content:
Seasonal temperatures in West Antarctica during the Holocene

Analysis of a continuous record of water-isotope ratios from the West Antarctic Ice Sheet Divide ice core reveals a dominant role for annual maximum insolation in determining West Antarctic summer temperature during the Holocene.

  • Tyler R. Jones
  • Kurt M. Cuffey
  • James W. C. White
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Long-range ordered porous carbons produced from C60
entry.content:
Long-range ordered porous carbons produced from C60

A new type of carbon, long-range ordered porous carbon, is synthesized from carbon fullerenes at the gram scale and under ambient pressure.

  • Fei Pan
  • Kun Ni
  • Yanwu Zhu
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Short tRNA anticodon stem and mutant eRF1 allow stop codon reassignment
entry.content:
Short tRNA anticodon stem and mutant eRF1 allow stop codon reassignment

Analyses of in-frame stop codons in protein-coding genes of Blastocrithidia nonstop with all three stop codons reassigned reveal a mechanism for UGA reassignment in eukaryotes involving shortening of the tRNA anticodon stem and a mutant eRF1 release factor.

  • Ambar Kachale
  • Zuzana Pavlíková
  • Julius Lukeš
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: An electric molecular motor
entry.content:
An electric molecular motor

An electrically driven motor on the molecular scale based on [3]catenane is described, in which two cyclobis(paraquat-p-phenylene) rings operate by means of redox reactions, demonstrating highly unidirectional movement around a circular loop.

  • Long Zhang
  • Yunyan Qiu
  • J. Fraser Stoddart
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: STEREO neutrino spectrum of 235U fission rejects sterile neutrino hypothesis
entry.content:
STEREO neutrino spectrum of 235U fission rejects sterile neutrino hypothesis

Accurate measurements of the antineutrino energy spectrum of 235U fission by the STEREO detector reject the sterile neutrino hypothesis and point to biases in the nuclear data to explain the discrepancies with the prediction.

  • H. Almazán
  • L. Bernard
  • M. Vialat
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Unitary p-wave interactions between fermions in an optical lattice
entry.content:
Unitary p-wave interactions between fermions in an optical lattice

The authors measure elastic p-wave interaction energies in pairs of fermionic atoms occupying the lowest two orbitals of an optical lattice; isolation of individual pairs of atoms protects against three-body recombination, enabling a theoretical maximum of interaction energy to be achieved.

  • Vijin Venu
  • Peihang Xu
  • Joseph H. Thywissen
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: An atlas of substrate specificities for the human serine/threonine kinome
entry.content:
An atlas of substrate specificities for the human serine/threonine kinome

Analysis of the kinase activity of 300 protein Ser/Thr kinases reveals that the substrate specificity of the kinome is substantially more diverse than expected and is driven extensively by negative selectivity

  • Jared L. Johnson
  • Tomer M. Yaron
  • Lewis C. Cantley
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Approaching the quantum limit in two-dimensional semiconductor contacts
entry.content:
Approaching the quantum limit in two-dimensional semiconductor contacts

The electrical contact of two-dimensional transistors is pushed close to the quantum limit by hybridization of the energy bands with antimony; the contacts have low contact resistance and excellent stability.

  • Weisheng Li
  • Xiaoshu Gong
  • Xinran Wang
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Periclase deforms more slowly than bridgmanite under mantle conditions
entry.content:
Periclase deforms more slowly than bridgmanite under mantle conditions

The authors model the creep of MgO periclase at lower mantle pressures and temperatures, finding that it deforms more slowly than bridgmanite at mantle strain rate.

  • Patrick Cordier
  • Karine Gouriet
  • Philippe Carrez
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Enhanced superconductivity in spin–orbit proximitized bilayer graphene
entry.content:
Enhanced superconductivity in spin–orbit proximitized bilayer graphene

Placing monolayer tungsten diselenide on Bernal-stacked bilayer graphene promotes enhanced superconductivity, indicating that proximity-induced spin–orbit coupling plays a key role in stabilizing the pairing, paving the way for engineering tunable, ultra-clean graphene-based superconductors.

  • Yiran Zhang
  • Robert Polski
  • Stevan Nadj-Perge
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Structural basis for intrinsic transcription termination
entry.content:
Structural basis for intrinsic transcription termination

Structural studies of Escherichia coli transcription intrinsic termination complexes representing distinct intermediates using cryo-electron microscopy provide insights into the steps and mechanism of transcription termination.

  • Linlin You
  • Expery O. Omollo
  • Yu Zhang
Article 11 Jan 2023
